bestPractices: Always provide a clear `label`. Avoid placeholder‑only fields; labels remain visible and accessible.
Choose the correct `type` (e.g., `email`, `password`, `number`) and set `autoComplete` to improve UX and a11y.
Pick a control model deliberately: use `value` + `onChange` for app‑state control; use `defaultValue` for simple local inputs.
In forms, set a stable `name` so values submit predictably and validation maps cleanly.
Use `as='textarea'` with `rows` for multi‑line input; keep width comfortable and avoid forcing long single‑line fields.
Convey issues via `error` + `helperText`. Keep helper text succinct; reserve errors for actionable feedback.
Use `fullWidth` in narrow or linear layouts; otherwise size with `sx` or parent layout for consistency.
Prefer theme tokens and `preset` over ad‑hoc CSS to keep density and colours consistent.

examples.title: Email + Password
examples.code:
<Stack gap={1}>
  <TextField name='email' type='email' label='Email' placeholder='you@example.com' autoComplete='email' />
  <TextField name='password' type='password' label='Password' autoComplete='new-password' />
</Stack>

examples.title: Multiline with helper
examples.code:
<Stack gap={1}>
  <TextField name='bio' as='textarea' rows={4} label='Bio' placeholder='Tell us about yourself' helperText='Use 2–3 sentences.' />
</Stack>
